newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine cash wheat firm on dryness.
newsitem.headline: Argentine cash wheat firm on dryness.

text.p: Argentine January cash wheat firmed in moderate turnover, with exporters nervous about dry weather, traders said.

But traders cautioned that August is normally dry and that wet weather generally begins in September. April cash maize was steady in middling volume, supported by a firmer Chicago. Spot maize eased in thin trade. The exporters' buying season is now mainly over. May cash soybeans firmed in moderate turnover. Spot cash soybeans rose in moderate volume too, buoyed by crushers' sales of oil and subproducts. Cash sunflower seed rose in thin volume, dragged along by firmer soybeans and also oil prices.
